de.esoco.ewt.layout

Class FlexLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.layout.GenericLayout
      • de.esoco.ewt.layout.FluentCssLayout<FlexLayout>
        • de.esoco.ewt.layout.FlexLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<FlexLayout>

    public class FlexLayout
extends FluentCssLayout<FlexLayout>
    A CSS flex layout implementation. It provides fluent builder methods like direction(Orientation) that can be invoked successively to set optional grid properties.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FlexLayout.ItemAlignment
      Enumeration of the flex layout item alignments.
      static class  FlexLayout.Wrapping
      Enumeration of the flex layout wrapping modes.

    • Method Detail

      • flexHorizontal

        public static FlexLayout flexHorizontal()
        A factory method to create a new instance with a horizontal layout direction for fluent invocations.
        Returns:
        The new flex layout

      • flexVertical

        public static FlexLayout flexVertical()
        A factory method to create a new instance with a vertical layout direction for fluent invocations.
        Returns:
        The new flex layout

      • align

        public FlexLayout align(de.esoco.lib.property.ContentAlignment eAlignment)
        Sets the alignment of the layout content along the secondary layout axis (#see method direction(Orientation, boolean)). This property will only have an effect if the layout has multiple lines because when wrapping occurs. Almost all content alignment values with the exception of SPACE_EVENLY are supported.
        Parameters:
        eAlignment - The horizontal content alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an unsupported aligment is provided

      • alignItems

        public FlexLayout alignItems(FlexLayout.ItemAlignment eAlignment)
        Sets the alignment of layout items along the secondary layout axis.
        Parameters:
        eAlignment - The item alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • direction

        public FlexLayout direction(de.esoco.lib.property.Orientation eDirection)
        Sets the direction of the item flow. This defines the main axis of the flex layout flow. The secondary axis runs in the other direction, perpendicular to the main axis.
        See Also:
        direction(Orientation, boolean)

      • direction

        public FlexLayout direction(de.esoco.lib.property.Orientation eDirection,
                            boolean bReverse)
        Sets the direction of the item flow. This defines the main axis of the flex layout flow. The secondary axis runs in the other direction, perpendicular to the main axis.
        Parameters:
        eDirection - The flow direction
        bReverse - TRUE to reverse the flow direction
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • inline

        public FlexLayout inline()
        Enables inline rendering (display = 'inline-flex').
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation

      • justify

        public FlexLayout justify(de.esoco.lib.property.ContentAlignment eAlignment)
        Sets the alignment of the layout content along the main layout axis (#see direction(Orientation, boolean)). Almost all content alignment values with the exception of STRETCH are supported.
        Parameters:
        eAlignment - The horizontal content alignment
        Returns:
        This instance for fluent invocation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an unsupported alignment is provided

      • applyLayoutStyle

        protected void applyWidgetStyle(StyleData rStyleData,
                                com.google.gwt.dom.client.Style rStyle)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
